Module Robotinterface
Package robotinterface.trigger

Class TriggerProcessor

java.lang.Object
robotinterface.trigger.TriggerProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
TriggerReceiver
public abstract class TriggerProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements TriggerReceiver
A processor for trigger messages. As a typcial pattern, a trigger processor keeps a state that is modified by incoming messages and it emits new trigger messages based on this state.
Note: there is no actual run method that performs the mapping nor any endless loop. The entire mapping code must be shifted to the TriggerReceiver.receiveTrigger(String) method.

    Methods inherited from interface robotinterface.trigger.TriggerReceiver

    receiveTrigger

  • Field Details

    • triggerSystem

      public TriggerSystem triggerSystem
      The system that distributes triggers among different receivers. The controller developer usually does not need this reference.

    • instanceNumber

      public int instanceNumber
      Which trigger instance number (to receiver triggers) is assigned to this trigger processor.

    • debugOut

      public Out debugOut
      An object that allows the developer to print debug text output to a console. The runtime environment may not be able to support a console. If not, such an object is available, but all debug prints are ignored.

    • eval

      public Evaluator eval
      The evaluator instance. With this, the robot can compute symbolic expressions with environment file constants.

  • Constructor Details

    • TriggerProcessor

      public TriggerProcessor()
      The developer should not override the creator. Instead, initialization code should be shifted to init().

  • Method Details

    • getDescription

      public java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns a short description of this trigger processor.
      Returns:
      (multiline) string description

    • requiresConfiguration

      public boolean requiresConfiguration()
      Indicates, whether the robot controller requires a configuration. If so, the developer has to override the configure() method.
      Returns:
      true if this controller requires a configuration

    • configure

      public void configure​(java.lang.String params) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Pass a configuration to the trigger processor. This method is executed directly after instantiation. The configuration is a processor-dependent string, usually passed as command-line argument. The entire parsing has to be performed by the processor.
      Parameters:
      params - a configuration string in processor-dependent format
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either the processor does not accept a configuration or the string is malformed

    • init

      public abstract void init() throws java.lang.Exception
      A method developed by the developer that contains code that is executed once directly after instantiation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - if something happens

    • sendTrigger

      public final void sendTrigger​(int instanceNumber, java.lang.String triggerString)
      Send a trigger to another robot controller or any trigger receiver.
      Parameters:
      instanceNumber - receiver robot controller number of instance number of the receiver
      triggerString - the event type – this is any string that only has a meaning for the respective receiver
